meanings.definition: A synthetic fiber used in textiles.
meanings.sent1: The jacket was made of dacrons, giving it a smooth and shiny appearance.
meanings.sent2: She preferred to wear clothes made of dacrons because they were easy to care for.
meanings.sent3: The fashion designer joked that he could probably make a whole wardrobe out of dacrons alone!
meanings.sent4: The dacrons in the curtains danced in the sunlight, creating a beautiful shimmer in the room.
meanings.sent5: As she ran her fingers over the dacrons, she marveled at how soft and durable they felt.

meanings.definition: A type of fabric made from dacron fibers.
meanings.sent1: The store had a sale on dacrons, so she bought a new dress made from the fabric.
meanings.sent2: The dacrons used in the dress made it lightweight and perfect for summer wear.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally spilled juice on his dacrons, turning his pants a bright orange color!
meanings.sent4: The dacrons of her scarf fluttered in the wind like colorful ribbons.
meanings.sent5: The dacrons of the blanket kept her warm and cozy on chilly nights.
